inputs: People put me down and try to tell me not to kill myself My entire life I've had people put me down.
No one had high expectations for me or expected me to be anything in life.
I started noticing it more when I started middle school.
People and teachers didn't think I was smart, artistic, or athletic.
They were right though, I'm in high school now and none of that has changed.
I was a liability to my middle school and I currently am a liability to my high school.
Even my friends don't expect much of me.
A long while ago I was telling a friend of mine that I thought that a person in the same room as was attractive.
They simply replied that I would never get that person ever.
I agree with that but it still makes me resentful how they had to express that so out loud.
I told another friend of mine that I'm stupid.
They said I'm not stupid, just slow at understanding things; which is the literal definition of retarded.
They also don't think I'll get into any colleges.
I also agree with that.
On top of my utter uselessness, I'm ugly and fuck and socially stupid.
I don't know how to make any friends.
Any time anyone is nice to me I go all out and annoy them because I'm just so desperate for a friendship.
&#x200B;

Even though people have been putting me down my whole life and never thought that I'd be anything more than a waste of space, they go and try to tell me that my life is worth living or that I shouldn't kill myself.
Why the fuck should I live any longer if I'm useless and a 100% waste of fucking space?

inputs: I feel so alone.
All the time.
The suicidal thoughts are not the worst part of the situation I’ve been in for the last eight years.
Nor is the Crohn’s disease.
Or the anxiety.
Or even the depression in general.
It is the all-encompassing, soul-crushing loneliness that I feel all the time, every single day, that makes it all unbearable.
I just want to be loved.
To be listened to.
Cared for.
I just want someone to give me a hug.
To tell me I matter and mean it.
And yet, even if I get those things (which is rare), it’s not enough.
It’s never enough.
My twisted mind always finds some way to doubt it.
Maybe they aren’t genuine.
Maybe they’re just saying that.
Why would a person as miserable and useless as me matter in the slightest to anyone other than perhaps my parents?
And I know I’m not alone.
I know hundreds of thousands of people, probably more, feel the exact same way I do.
label: crisis

inputs: Broke up with my boyfriend over Trump We were together for a couple of years.
he's Jewish, much older.
I'm not religious and detest organized religion, especially the kind that raises one type of peoples over others.
he was the most loving, kindest man.
though, he always had to be right about politics and such things.
that made me more and more resentful over time.
I was disappointed that he thought that sun's activity was to blame for climate change, not human activity.
Obviously, a man harboring delusions so as to sustain his personal worldview.
The night that Trump got elected, I was flabbergasted.
We were together.
As the stock market predicted that Trump would win, he beamed from ear to ear and said, "Don't you see, this is really good for me!
I couldn't really understand.
That was the weirdest night.
His loyalty to Trump has remained steadfast.
I couldn't handle it any longer.
The breaking point was when I asked him how he would feel, knowing that millions of poor kids would be without health insurance in January, as a consequence of the GOP tax bill.
I'd prefer to be with someone who would feel hurt by such a thing, you know.
He was very defensive, of course.
I guess I can understand.
Very angry.

inputs: I lost everyone Hey I'm 15 yo boy and i always wanted to have someone who would genuinely care for me.
I've always been shy and bad at making friends.
Idk the source of my shyness, maybe it's because my dad left me when I was 2 and I always waited for him to come back?
I felt that I was worse than everybody, because I didn't have dad, I couldn't ride a bike, I was fat, I was bad at sports (these all things didn't change at all since then).
I cried a lot because my grandma often screamed at me because I did something wrong ( I was just a child).
Everyone in the family didn't cared too much about me crying ( they cared but I never heard "sorry").
Through preschool and middle school I had few friends but most of them were toxic to me but I couldn't stand up to them.
In 4th grade I had a crush on this one girl ( I still do) but she doesn't like me back.
In 7th grade I met my group of friends that I would hang out with but I still felt kinda left behind.
I was very positive about going to high school because of the new people.
Nobody talked to me though.
It felt surreal to not have anyone to hang out with or don't say a word for a whole day.
I changed school to previous one where I had 1 friend.
It felt awesome to have a friend.
After 2 months he was a stranger to me.
Now my grades are much worse than before, because I just don't have motivation.
All my friends and family members from my life are gone.
They just fade away.
I don't have a close relationship with anyone in my family.
Everyone (teachers, classmates, family) thinks I'm antisocial and isolating myself on purpose.

inputs: Sleep anxiety I'm not sure if this belongs here, I can remove it if so, but it's 3 am and Im all alone and covered in sweat.
I was kind of paralyzed in my bed for the past.
Hour?
Couple minutes?
God knows how long.
It was probably the most terrifying thing ever.
I was sleeping but I was also aware.
It was like my mind was tricking me over and over again into thinking I could wake up from this weird state of consciousness but I couldn't.
Like being trapped just beneath the surface of water.
It was the weirdest thing but not scary in itself.
It only ever happened to me once before months ago but this was much, much much worse than that time.
I kept trying to wake myself up again and again because I knew I was dreaming, but every time I got close to the surface of consciousness I was pulled back under.
Like my mind was repeatedly trapping itself.
First I was tossing and turning so badly (in my nightmare?
) trying to wake up because I knew something was wrong.
I kept falling out of bed and I would "wake up" only to have the process repeat.
Each successive time it got worse and worse.
I can't really describe it.
I was "falling" into sleep.
I would jerk awake only to realize I was still in my dream and *that* was my nightmare.

inputs: Never thought I'd post here but its all come crashing down today.
Ive actually grown to hate myself more than I ever had in just the past hour or so.
It's a really long story, and i know im a complete asshole and piece of shit for it but I'll be happy, just to know that i was able to tell just someone what was going through my mind.
Backstory is, I was my parents' unwanted accident child and i never felt like i was wanted anywhere.
Any friends that I made were just people to pass the time, none of them actually cared about me.
I never even planned to live past high school and I was just deadset on making it to 18 then leaving.
Then, I met my best friend, purely by chance since we were partnered for taking care of a club for just a day.
I genuinely just grew to love her and before I knew it she became the only reason I had to live.
I actually, thought there might be something worth living past 18 for.

But, keep in mind the past 17 years of my life i built myself up in my mind to be a worthless piece of shit that can't do anything right and I genuinely couldn't understand why she wanted to stick around with me.
And therein is the root of my jealousy.

I really, couldn't handle her spending more time with lther people than myself, I kept thinking that it was only a matter of time before she woke up and realized there were plenty of better people she could have in her life.
Evem though she constantly tried to reassure me that she never was going to leave or replace me.
But I still just couldn't believe any of it.
Fast forward to just tonight where i came off a really shit day and really just hated myself.
She invited me to join her and a friend of mine in a game and, I just lost it.

I, i really dont know what happened but i just ended up pushing her away and just saying that the day she ended up replacing me, please have it be one of the only people i considered an actual friend.
The second i said that i really regretted it.
Too little too late though, cause i could tell i crossed a line and no matter what kind of apologies I made it didn't make a difference since she probably hates me now anyway.
Now im just, sitting here writing this on my phone while trying to keep myself from tossing myself off the deep end.

inputs: It’s 3am I feel super sick - here’s my story, just in case it’s the only place I get to tell it When I was younger I wanted to be a writer; I had this vision that I could write for somewhere like the New York Times and release a few books along the way.
When I was younger I still wrote for fun, my grammar was sloppier and more haphazard, but I had all these colours to choose from.
My writing then was saturated.
Now, I don’t write unless I have to.
My writing is technically better, but all I have are shades of beige; I constantly feel like I’m writing for someone else and subsequently everything feels just slightly inauthentic.
Calculated, not colourful.
In a way it’s a good metaphor for where I am now, all the colour I thought adult life would bring me has gone.
In reality I know when I was younger my sadness was just more repressed; that I wasn’t ever really happy - but, I had better moments.
It may have been denial, but I’d kill to believe I wasn’t depressed again.
If you didn’t get it already, I’m much older now and somehow despite more therapy and much more effort, I’m also much sadder.
I have these two mindsets around death.
The first, I’m sure drawn from literature, paints death in this kind of (problematically) endearing way - I picture killing myself as drowning at the beach I’d go to with my dad as a kid.
I imagine the colour lifting from my skin under the water, like it was paint and my body a canvas.
In death I envision this idea of absolution; that everything has had a purpose leading up to now, and all the sadness and all the pain can finally be let go of.
The other picture I have of suicide is the more realistic, it’s me writing letters to all my loved ones, dying alone in a hotel room (sparing details here for obvious reasons).
The latter is meaningless and all it represents is the passing of all the pain I have being dispersed amongst the people I love most.
My life now content wise is good I guess, I have a boyfriend who I love more than anything in the world, and beautiful deeply caring thoughtful friends.
I’ll graduate a lawyer from a top tier university in a few years (assuming I’m still here).
I have pretty much everything that I thought would make me happy.
It’s just never enough.
label: crisis

inputs: I’ve been struggling with suicidal tendencies since I don’t even remember and I think I’m genuinely ready to give up.
Obligatory I’m on mobile, might edit on my laptop if I feel like it but anyway.
Also forgive any typos, I’m not proofreading this.
I’m tired.
Like the title says, I really don’t remember the last time I wasn’t in the slightest way suicidal.
My life for the past 7 years has been scraping by and trying to find small ways to stay alive because I’ve been to scared to really do it.
I’ve gotten close, there’s been a couple nights of standing on a bridge after work for a couple hours or starting to set up some sort of hanging rig with a belt but I always pussy out.
About 5 months ago, I moved out of my abusive household.

I finally made it out, but now I’ve spent all of my teenage years putting all my planning into getting out to think about shit like the future after that; I was so sure that I wasn’t even gonna live to see myself get out, so it was hard to think about anything but that.
It was my only goal, once I get out I can plan after that kinda thing.
So I got out, doing so by moving into my college’s dorms the second I turned 18.
I paid out of pocket with the money I saved up working 40/week at a fast food joint.

I did it, I got out, but then the dorms ate up my savings and I was having a bit of a crisis; I now had 5 months to plan where I’ll go after this, no car, no credit, fully independent from my parents with no clue how to do shit because I’ve essentially been a captive for 7 years who had to learn everything about the world completely on my own.
So now we’re here.

I have some rigorous classes, so I’ve been focusing on those, I’ve been trying to work of Fiverr to have a little bit of income, I’ve been bringing myself out of constant depressive and suicidal episodes by reminding myself I actually have a life goal to look forward to now and everything was getting a little better really slowly.

It’s been a one step forward two steps back kinda deal with my mental health, and it’s something I’ve been dealing with completely on my own because I don’t have any access to mental health recourses like therapy and none of my friends are really emotionally there so it’s been rough, but at the end of the day I’ve at least been trying to find reasons to live.
A couple days ago, my school extended spring break because of COVID-19, and today I got news that all housing students are being kicked out.
I have nowhere to go, I don’t have a job, most people don’t have a job right now because everyone’s work is getting shut down.

No one can afford to take anyone in right now even if I did feel like I had a friend I could stay with, and I can imagine trying to get an apartment right now with everything going on is probably impossible even for someone with good credit and a job.
Nothing is looking good right now.

inputs: My mom told me to kill myself I want to start off by saying that i'm 22, I grew up in an abusive home, physically and emotionally, which is probably why I ended up the way I did.

inputs: I'm feeling scared and overwhelmed right now.
I recently went through a breakup and it has stirred up so much anxiety within me.
Yes, Alex, I do.
I think the breakup has triggered a fear of abandonment and uncertainty about the future.
I keep replaying moments from the relationship in my mind, wondering what I could have done differently.
It's consuming my thoughts and causing sleepless nights.
I feel like I failed in the relationship, and that belief is intensifying my anxiety.
I constantly worry that I won't find love again or be able to maintain a healthy relationship.
It's as if my self-worth is tied to this breakup, making me doubt my ability to be happy again.
Well, I've always been compassionate towards others, and I genuinely care about people's well-being.
I believe my empathy has helped me connect with others on a deeper level.
I'm also proud of my resilience and ability to adapt to challenging situations.
I've started practicing mindfulness and incorporating meditation into my daily routine.
It has helped me observe my anxious thoughts without getting caught up in them.
I've also reached out to friends for support, and their understanding has been comforting.
They have been incredibly supportive and understanding.
They actively listen without judgment and offer words of encouragement.
Their presence makes me feel less alone in this journey of healing.
Yes, I've noticed that certain places, songs, or even scents can trigger memories of the relationship and heighten my anxiety.
It's like my mind associates those triggers with the pain of the breakup, making it difficult to stay calm.
